p: The clinical presentation of COVID-19 can be indistinguishable from other viral causes of pneumonia and include fever (83–98%), dry cough (76–82%), and fatigue or myalgia (11–44%) ( 74, 75). The median age of confirmed COVID-19 cases is in the 6th decade of life with a slight male predominance. Twenty-five percent of patients have severe symptoms requiring intensive care treatment of which 10% develop respiratory failure requiring mechanical ventilation. Chest radiograph imaging of these patients reveals bilateral patchy infiltrates and CT imaging shows ground-glass infiltrates. Patients typically present with laboratory findings of prolonged prothrombin time, elevated lactate dehydrogenase, and lymphopenia (70% of patients) ( 76). However, it is unclear if the lymphopenia is related to direct cytotoxic effect of the virus or underlying chronic conditions ( 77, 78).
